intro: Haarera alternifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, alternate leaves that form a dense, grass-like foliage. Haarera alternifolia typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It is often found in the understorey of native forests, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
